remarks: The limit of an infinite product with an initial segment removed. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 20-Dec-2017.)
statement:
clim2div.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
clim2div.2 $e |- ( ph -> N e. Z ) $.
clim2div.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) e. CC ) $.
clim2div.4 $e |- ( ph -> seq M ( x. , F ) ~~> A ) $.
clim2div.5 $e |- ( ph -> ( seq M ( x. , F ) ` N ) =/= 0 ) $.
clim2div $p |- ( ph -> seq ( N + 1 ) ( x. , F ) ~~> ( A / ( seq M ( x. , F ) ` N ) ) ) $.
$d F k $.
$d M k $.
$d N k $.
$d Z k $.
$d k ph $.
